amendatorysection.catchline: Recognizance forfeited; satisfaction; forfeiture set aside or remitted; exoneration of surety.
amendatorysection.para: When the conditions of the recognizance have been satisfied or the forfeiture thereof has been set aside or remitted, the court shall exonerate the obligors and release any bail. A surety may be exonerated by a deposit of cash in the amount of the recognizance or by a timely surrender of the defendant into custody.

crossreference.para: Disposition of funds of forfeited recognizance, see section 29-2708.
